messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 63 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Macroscopic stress, couple stress and flux tensors derived through energetic equivalence from microscopic continuous and discrete heterogeneous finite representative volumes

Paper Abstract: 

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 63 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 63"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Simulating the Poisson effect in lattice models of elastic continua",
        "Elastically-homogeneous lattice models of damage in geomaterials",
        "Microstructural Stress Tensor of Granular Assemblies With Volume Forces",
        "Stress and strain in granular assemblies",
        "Numerical stress analysis of granular material",
        "The asymmetry of stress in granular media",
        "Simulation of shrinkage induced cracking in cement composite overlays",
        "Discrete mechanical models of concrete fracture",
        "Micromechanical Approach in Granular Materials",
        "Damage and plasticity in microplane theory",
        "On virtual work and stress in granular media",
        "Constitutive relation for a particulate medium with the effect of particle rotation",
        "Lattice modelling of early-age creep of 3D printed segments with the consideration of stress history",
        "A Micromechanical Description of Granular Material Behavior",
        "A Time Integration Algorithm for Structural Dynamics With Improved Numerical Dissipation: The Generalized-αalpha Method",
        "Confinement-shear lattice CSL model for fracture propagation in concrete Computational Modelling of Concrete",
        "Lattice Discrete Particle Model (LDPM) for failure behavior of concrete. I: Theory",
        "Discontinuous Cell Method (DCM) for the simulation of cohesive fracture and fragmentation of continuous media",
        "About the numerical simulation of the dynamics of granular media and the definition of the mean stress tensor Topics in Micromechanics of Heterogeneous Materials",
        "Photoelastic verification of a mechanical model for the flow of a granular material",
        "Analytical investigation of the role of reinforcement in perpendicular beams of beam-column knee joints by 3D meso-scale model",
        "Multiscale analysis of brittle failure in heterogeneous materials",
        "Boundary Layer Effect on Behavior of Discrete Models",
        "Elastic properties of isotropic discrete systems: Connections between geometric structure and Poisson’s ratio",
        "Homogenization of discrete mesoscale model of concrete for coupled mass transport and mechanics by asymptotic expansion",
        "Homogenization of discrete diffusion models by asymptotic expansion",
        "Stochastic lattice discrete particle modeling of fracture in pervious concretel",
        "Generalized mathematical homogenization of atomistic media at finite temperatures in three dimensions",
        "Asymptotic analysis of heterogeneous Cosserat media",
        "Construction of an averaged stress tensor for a granular medium",
        "Mean stress in a granular medium in dynamics",
        "Mean stress tensor of discrete particle systems in submerged conditions",
        "A lattice approach to model flow in cracked concrete",
        "Three-Dimensional Network Model for Coupling of Fracture and Mass Transport in Quasi-Brittle Geomaterials",
        "Application of the discrete element method to study heat transfer by conduction in particulate composite materials",
        "Modeling of physical fields by means of the Cosserat continuum",
        "Variationally consistent computational homogenization of chemomechanical problems with stabilized weakly periodic boundary conditions",
        "Micromechanical Definition of the Strain Tensor for Granular Materials",
        "Statics and kinematics of discrete Cosserat-type granular materials",
        "A novel DEM-based pore-scale thermal-hydro-mechanical model for fractured non-saturated porous materials",
        "A comparison of discrete granular material models with continuous microplane formulations",
        "Variationally consistent computational homogenization of transient heat flow",
        "Asymmetry of the stress tenor in granular materials",
        "A treatise on the mathematical theory of elasticity",
        "New perspectives on polygonal and polyhedral finite element methods",
        "Adaptive discretization refinement for discrete models of coupled mechanics and mass transport in concrete",
        "Computational modeling of the out-of-plane behavior of unreinforced irregular masonry",
        "On the definition of the stress tensor in granular media",
        "Lessons learned from matching 3D DEM and experiments at macro, meso and fabric scales for triaxial compression tests on lentils",
        "Discrete element models of fracture in tooth enamel: Failure mode competition and statistical effects",
        "Asymptotic expansion homogenization of discrete fine-scale models with rotational degrees of freedom for the simulation of quasi-brittle materials",
        "A Micromechanical Definition of the (C)auchy Stress Tensor for Particulate Media",
        "An enhanced lattice beam element model for the numerical simulation of rate-dependent self-healing in cementitious materials",
        "Prediction of the mechanical behavior of nonlinear heterogeneous systems by multi-level finite element modeling",
        "The effects of particle dynamics on the calculation of bulk stress in granular media",
        "Phase segmentation in X-ray CT images of concrete with implications for mesoscale modeling",
        "Cosserat Continuum Mechanics",
        "DEM analysis on the role of aggregates on concrete strength",
        "Recherches concernant les contraintes intergranulaires dans les milieux pulvérulents",
        "Definition and symmetry of averaged stress tensor in granular media and its 3D DEM inspection under static and dynamic conditions",
        "A DEM study on the effective thermal conductivity of granular assemblies",
        "Quadrilateral isoparametric finite elements for plane elastic Cosserat bodies",
        "Discrete Modeling of Elastic Heterogeneous Media"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 63 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Macroscopic stress, couple stress and flux tensors derived through energetic equivalence from microscopic continuous and discrete heterogeneous finite representative volumes, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
